chapter.title: Cloning Disk Images
chapter.para: If &productname; is installed in a virtualized environment, cloning an existing installation is the fastest way to deploy further machines. &productname; provides a script to clean up configuration that is unique to each installation. With the introduction of systemd, cloning is no longer the recommended way to build system images as unique system identifiers are used and set in different locations and files in the system. To clone disks of machines, refer to the documentation of your virtualization environment.

sect1.title: Cleaning Up Unique System Identifiers

warning.title: Important Configuration Loss
warning.para: Executing the following procedure permanently deletes important system configuration. If the source system for the clone is used in production, run the clean up script on the cloned image.

sect1.para: To clean all unique system identifiers, execute the following procedure before or after cloning a disk image. If run on the clone, this procedure has to be run on each clone.
